trial_identification.studytitle: TKR Patient Outcomes using Wii Enhanced Rehabilitation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial comparing standard rehabilitation versus additional exercises using the Nintendo Wii-Fit following Total Knee Replacement in patients who have undergone a primary unilateral total knee replacement.

interventions.interventions: 12 weeks of Nintendo Wii-Fit exercises at home performed using the Wii console and the Wii-Fit software and balance board. The exercises will be selected from the Wii-Fit software and prescribed in increasing difficulty through the phases - 6-8 weeks, 8-12 weeks and 12-18 weeks. Prescribed at least three times a week for 30 minutes per session. The subjects in both groups will maintain an exercise diary of all exercises performed and physiotherapy attendances. The Wii also records all exercises performed. Any physiotherapy attendance will be at the recommendation of the rehabilitation staff on discharge from in-patient rehabilitation or at the request of the treating surgeon. Both groups will receive a phone call in the first week of the 12 week intervention period to answer questions and check progress. Further phone-calls will be scheduled as necessary.
interventions.comparator: Standard treatment - The standard rehabilitation protocols used by each participating surgeon. The subjects in both groups will maintain an exercise diary of all exercises performed and physio attendances. Any physiotherapy attendance will be at the recommendation of the rehabilitation staff on discharge from in-patient rehabilitation or at the request of the treating surgeon. primaryOutcome.outcome: The difference in functional outcome between the two groups as assessed by WOMAC score.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Subjective improvement in joint specific functional outcome measured by Oxford knee score
Strength of knee flexors and extensors assessed by handheld dynanometry
Balance assessed by double leg and single leg stances on Biodex balance SD and Nintendo Wii
General health status assessed by SF-12 questionnaire
American knee society objective score measuring knee joint alignment and range of motion.
Hospital Anxiety and Depression score - HADS
Locus of Control score - patient reported questionnaire

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Primary, unilateral total knee replacement English speaking
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Neurological or inner ear balance disorders Bilateral knee replacements. Unicondylar knee replacements Dementia

trial_design.concealment: The decision to include the patient in the trial is made before the patient is allocated to a group. The allocation is made using sequentially-numbered, sealed, opaque envelopes.
trial_design.designfeatures: In answer to the query above on blinding. The prinicipal investigator will know the group allocation but the research staff taking the measurements will not.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a prospective randomized controlled trial looking to compare two groups of patients having total knee replacements. One group will follow a standard rehabilitation protocol following the operation and the other will have a supplementary program of exercises using the Wii-Fit from week 6 to week 18. We will compare a number of outcomes including self-reported functional scores, strength and balance at 18 weeks and 1 year after the operation.
